headline: The best place I have ever worked
pros:
Great Leadership
A lot of growth opportunities
cons: I miss seeing my team member but that will return again

headline: Project Manager Five9
pros: Overall a strategically, well Managed company with fair compensation and one of the best companies in my career. Very good culture with a desire to help each other and clients. Senior management, (CEO/CFO), is very good. Until recently the rapitly rising stock price equated to a very nice bonus over the years.
cons: Some limits exist on advancement, but there is an effort to promote from within. 401 matching is low, although other benefits for healthcare are good. Many if not most employees are remote and can work from home, especially, during COVID.. Some work/life balance issues, but that is department-based and has been better in recent years. All in all, I considered myself lucky to have worked here

headline: Best Place I Have Worked
pros: I have been with Five9 for almost 4 years and I absolutely love it here. I feel supported in my role by my coworkers and my boss, and feel like I have an opportunity to grow my career within the organization. I can honestly say I am very proud to work for Five9 and hope to work here for many more years.
cons: The growth can feel like a con at times, because small close teams turn into much bigger teams. But overall the growth has been very positive, and I feel like Five9 does a good job of pursuing a good company culture regardless of how fast we are growing.

headline: Five9 takes care of its employees
pros:
- Support from management 
- Product functionality 
- Pay 
- Mobility within the organization
cons: - Not always a con, but this is a very busy job

headline: Special Culture and Exciting Growth At Five9
pros:
From the top down, culture is sacred and carefully preserved.
Five9 leadership makes decisions founded in integrity and doing the right thing. CEO Rowan is extremely in-tune with how employees are feeling as a whole and responds to that very directly and effectively.
The CSM team is a group of top tier professionals with a spirit of service, helping one another and focusing on the customer.
The growth since going public in 2014 has been staggering, with every quarter being a record over the year prior. The trajectory continues along this path with a huge available market and a continuing shift to cloud with a focus on the contact center.
Five9 is very understanding and fosters work life balance, encouraging time off to really disconnect by having an "out of office buddy" to care for your accounts while you are away.
Pre-Pandemic, events like Sales Kick-off and President's Club at the beach were an all-out blast. Hoping to return to these in-person gatherings very soon.
Sales onboarding and Boot Camps are the best in the industry.
cons: There are no unique cons at Five9 that one wouldn't find at any contact center / CCaaS provider anywhere else around the globe. Growing pains, emerging markets with challenging regulatory landscapes, and the occasional tech hiccups can feel like major setbacks when they are occurring. However Five9 takes all of these situations as lessons, truly internalizes them, and uses them to drive continuous improvement.

headline: ehhh
pros: great product, c level executives were great, customer success & implementation teams were outstanding
cons: terrible sales culture and poor inexperienced sales leaders. HR is also non-existent and there to only help management, not employees.

headline: Real Review
pros:
Good work life balance
Ideas and innovations are valued.
cons: No free food here :D

headline: This company is amazing!!!
pros: I love this place! My team is small but the work life balance is incredible, the people are great, and the leadership is amazing. Rowan really listens to the employees within this organization.
cons: None that I can think of.

headline: A breath of fresh air
pros:
I have worked for a number of companies within the contact center and CX space and Five9 is a head above the rest, in my opinion.

-FANTASTIC culture
-Great product
-Reputable and recognizable brand
-Amazing people
-Thorough and digestible onboarding
-Fair territories

Leadership treats you as a seasoned professional, trusting you to take care of your business, and is more than willing to jump in and help, regardless of their seniority. You're provided with all the tools (lots of them) and resources in order to maximize your sales efforts. And the team resources provided to support you are extensive.
cons: My biggest con thus far is the amount of internal processes needed in order to complete a sale. Seemingly small tasks oftentimes need to go through an approval process in order to get done. However, I've come to learn that these processes are in place in order to ensure that we're confident and able to deliver for our customers.

headline: Incredible company!
pros: Five9 is an incredible company and the leadership team (from the CEO down) truly puts employees first and understand that happy employees mean happy customers. Five9 invests in resources to help ensure you can successfully do your job. And Five9 truly cares about our customers and goes above and beyond to ensure customer success and happiness. The leadership team is 100% invested in employee success and work with you to succeed. The company offers great benefits as well.
cons: I truly have seen no cons. I've worked for several companies in my 20+ yrs and I have never felt so included and supported and have never had so many tools to help me be successful.

headline: All about customer success & doing the right thing
pros: Great company and culture that is focused on helping customers be successful. Very smart, professional and respectful co-workers. I feel supported and always asked what leadership can do to help me be successful. Best company I have ever worked for! Fun, energetic and innovative co-workers that make it a blast to work with each day!
cons: Honestly, I love it here and Five9 does a ton to grow, mature and become a global, thriving, successful company.

headline: Best place to work for
pros: Great place to work, friendly team, good benefits too
cons: lots of off hour works and new management trying out too many new things

headline: You will NEVER be bored.
pros:
Let's be concise to not have the whole TLDR...
- Great Culture! What the heck does that mean anyway? Well, a leadership driven culture where LEADERS lead properly to have a positive working environment and open door policy.
- Fantastic CEO - People oriented, honest sometimes brutally honest which is needed in this day and age and has an appropriate level of transparency.
- Great working teams (Professional Services, CSM's, TAM's, Sales, Training, Management)
- Shared goals!
cons:
Of course this is subjective...
- Benefits could be a little better with specialized health, 
- Stock purchase limits could be a little higher
- Some managers need to come out of the "That is how we always did it" mentality and think more critically into "We should find a better way to do it".

headline: Thirteenth Facade
pros: A good company, no doubt. Generous compensation, flexible hours, remote work, challenging products. Easy going overall, and people are generally happy.
cons:
Five9 received Glassdoor's Employees' Choice Award for 13th best place to work. Happy employees and ballot box stuffing are not mutually exclusive.

Change-averse, risk-averse culture
Siloed teams
Poor inter-team transparency 
Performance bonuses perversely disincentivize change and progress
Some company mottos antithetical to reality

headline: Growing and fast paced
pros: Company is growing fast and there are good things to come. Have to be ready to jump in and hit the ground running. Think BIG. Great people to work with. Great benefits
cons: Growing pains like in any other company but if you are focused you will do just fine.

headline: Awesome company, culture, product and leadership!
pros:
- High growth means there is a great work environment
- Leadership is more transparent than I've seen in many other companies
- Very supportive culture where everyone tries to go above and beyond, anticipate your ask and go a great job. High levels of employee engagement!
- You are encouraged to bring ideas and make improvements
cons:
- Still can feel a bit like a start-up sometimes - in the sense that the company is run as one business unit with a core product, and everyone is figuring out the way to do things on the fly
- Related to the above, company infrastructure is less mature than at some established companies - in terms of team structure, support services, staffing.
- PTO is much smaller than competitors

headline: Great place to be!
pros: Leadership, Colleagues, Work-Life Balance and Compensation
cons: I haven't found any cons so far

headline: Customer, Partner and Employee-Centric Company
pros: Company culture from top down and bottoms up encourages everyone to do the right thing for Customers, Partners and teammates. People go the extra mile as the norm. The vibe is friendly and motivating. Employees are smart, resourceful and fun. Lots of fun groups create an engaging and also inclusive atmosphere - i.e. five9 pride, five9 dogs, five9 foodies, five9 women in tech. Employees are encouraged end empowered to improve processes and approach to deliver the best experiences. C-level leadership is very transparent, sharing their perspective and strategy and very accessible (you can ask estaff questions at any time and they will get right back to you).
cons: May not be for you if you don't like a high growth, fast-paced environment and autonomy/accountability.

headline: Absolutely the best corporate culture
pros: It's so rare for a company to grow for years and keep a strong, positive corporate culture. The management team at Five9 has done an exceptional job of doing just that. Every employee is valued, everyone helps each other and we are all focused on doing what's right for our customers. Truly an exceptional place to work.
cons: No company is perfect. No matter where you work there will always be issues to work through and Five9 is no different. What makes the challenges easier and address and keeps things moving forward is a culture of inclusion, engagement and doing the right thing. Hard to call this a "con" at all.

headline: Grateful to be acquired by Five9
pros: Five9 has an exceptional culture. The people are great to work with and supportive. I am impressed with leadership especially during this pandemic. They ensure that we are taking care of ourselves and also provide extra care with the occasional surprise mental health days off or just to recognize all the hard work everyone is doing. There are great programs for us all to get involved in that supports diversity and inclusion as well as fitness and well-being.
cons: My previous company was acquired during the pandemic so I haven't been able to meet a lot of coworkers in person yet so that is a con that is out of everyone's control but, thus far, I'm not finding any cons to working at Five9.

headline: Hidden Gem with great Culture
pros:
Low Bureaucracy work culture
Great Leadership team
Employee focused company culture
Flexible schedule, remote friendly company (even after pandemic)
Differentiated products
cons:
Not really con, but benefits and perks could be better. I know HR is working hard to keep our benefits and perks competitive.

Under Investment in non-sales departments.

Company is growing so definitely some growing pains.

headline: Innovative & People Focused
pros:
Five9 is focused on innovation with its products and vision for the future. The organization is professional and centered around its people and its clients (values family and personal well being).
I've been impressed by the smart and seasoned professionals at all levels.
There are many opportunities to get involved and meet others, based on personal and professional interests. 
Everyone I have met has been willing to help, upbeat and positive.
cons: Joined during pandemic and haven't had much opportunity to meet people in person...but that's about it

headline: Always looking out for employees
pros: They are always looking for ways to make their employees happy. This is not limited to compensation only. They take strides to make sure extraordinary personal goals and work life balance can be achieved. Of course they cannot say 'yes' to everything but the balance they achieve is commendable.
cons: The opposite of the Pros. Trying to make everyone happy can create its own issues. This is not bad in and of itself but can seem distracting at times. But nothing to stop anyone from enjoying the great environment.

headline: A Company where you can Win!!!
pros:
Great Work from Home Enablement
Strong highly experience employees
CEO that get's people
Those about me as my managers are there to support me, and are willing to assist in my success
A product that has weaknesses but overall delivers to customers expectations
We are a growing company where we win quarter over quarter
cons:
Growth has presented challenges in product development, global support, product support.
Overall, it is hard to find any major faults with Five9. Yes, there are things that can improve, but I love working here.

headline: Growing Company Focused on Customers and Employees
pros: FIve9 has an amazing work-life balance, employees are as important as our customers. The C-Suite has an open door policy and they mean it, they are very open and honest about upcoming events and the state of the business. It is not the typical corporate working environment, definitely a unicorn!
cons: Being completely transparent, there are really no cons to working at Five9. We are extremely busy and work hard, but the company recognizes that and continues hiring, and surprise the entire company with unexpected days off!

headline: Still Amazing After 1 Year
pros: The people and the culture are unmatched. I haven't met a single a-hole in my first year which is impressive in a company of our size. Everything is about TEAM and shared success. The e-staff is incredibly thoughtful and proactive to constantly nurture the culture.
cons: There are no cons to working at Five9, period!

headline: One of the best places I have worked for
pros: The culture and learning and opportunities for growth at the Company are better that any I have had. I have learned so much here. The people are some of the brightest people I know and management allows us to be creative and I have been surprised twice with company wide extra days off which was awesome. In addition we are super successful.
cons: The 401k match is a little small but other than that I really have loved it here.

headline: N/A
pros: Good values and theres good work life balance
cons: Not that I can think of

headline: Great Company
pros: Very sales focus and oriented.
cons: A bit "transactional" vs. "relationship" sales approach for its legacy offerings.

headline: As good inside as it sounds
pros:
Authentic, transparent senior leadership
Genuine focus on what is best for employees with action 
Guiding principals are centered on customer satisfaction
Filled with staff that want to be here and will make time to help always
Very active ERG with options for everyone to connect in numerous ways, even while working remotely
Investment in development, marketing, programs, benefits, education, etc.
cons: Fast growth has led to some retained inefficient processes, but even with that, there is recognition and investment for improvements

headline: Best company to work for!
pros: Five9 truly values their employees and is committed to promoting from within and helping the team achieve their career goals. Even with everyone being remote, Five9 has found ways to keep the teams connected and possibly more productive than ever before. I couldn't think of a better place to work!
cons: While a very short term issue, the possible Zoom acquisition has provided a distraction to employees. Communication from the CEO down has been frequent but team members are feeling the uncertainty of what the future of the organization will look like.

headline: Great Place to Work
pros:
In my 20+ years in IT, this is easily the best company I have ever been a part of. 
-Great compensation and benefits
-Great leadership
-Great work/life balance
-Amazing company culture
-Transparent and communicative e-staff
-Development opportunities abound
-They are always striving to improve whether it be in processes, people, or products
-Great remote work policies
cons: There's not many cons. No employer is perfect, but if anything I'd say the crazy amount of growth occurring here has caused many of us to fill in areas where we normally would not. We do it happily, I might add.

headline: Good Company, Great People
pros: Five9 has a hands-off upper management, giving each team more flexibility when it comes to compensation, work hours, and position. I like my manager so i have a good job.
cons: Recent rapid growth is causing growing pains in engineering like less communication and more worloadd on key engineers.

headline: By far the best company I have worked at!
pros: Five9 is by far the best company I have worked for. The company and team culture is great. Everyone is so supportive of each other and the product is constantly evolving to keep up with contact center space. I couldn't be more excited to see where Five9 will be in the next few years!
cons: System outages can be frustrating and happen more often than we would like. Especially when as CSMs where we are the first line of communication when they happen.

headline: Great Culture, Great Opportunities
pros: Amazing team culture that is comprised of the employees, the way the employees work together, company values and processes. Development opportunities are available for employees to participate in and there is transparency from the top down. Five9 truly cares for employees and offers great incentives and benefits.
cons: Lack of system and IT processes for scale and lack of investment in overall infrastructure to scale. Management, please address.

headline: The Best Culture!
pros:
-CcaaS is blowing up and Five9 is in a great position product/people wise.
-If you perform, you have opportunity to move up, simple as that.
- My favorite part about Five9 is everyone is ALWAYS willing to go above and beyond to help one and other. We win and lose together.
- Leadership is selfless and transparent
- Stock + healthcare included
cons: No cons that I can think of. 401K match would be great, but other benefits of stock + healthcare are included.

headline: After a year - still enjoying working for a transparent company
pros: 1. Open communication from lower to executive management. 2. Great co-workers who love to teach, help, and learn. 3. ESPP. 4. Growth not only as a company, but opportunities to grown individually.
cons: 1. Well, the stock tanked a bit due to the possible and now nixed Zoom acquisition. 2. Don't yet have open time for vacation/PTO - still limited to set hours.

headline: Beware
pros: Good produce, well suited for mid-market in North America
cons: There is a go along to get ahead mentality, the sales team and leadership protect the old-timers so they do extremely well, but anyone new coming along will struggle to be accepted. And the arrogance exhibited by the sales leaders is beyond comprehension

headline: Have never been happier!
pros:
Culture is like nothing I have seen before - transparent communication from Executive Leadership. Managers CARE about you and what you to succeed. 

I love the Employee Resource Groups - the Pride group is new and flourishing!
cons: Can't think of any downsides - I love it here.

headline: Awesome culture!
pros:
* Company is growing incredibly fast , lots of opportunities
* Great leadership! 
* Awesome culture. It really feels like a small company.
* Startup culture! Engineering culture of experimentation & iteration. They are not stuck like most enterprise companies
cons:
* Work life balance could be better, but thats recognized and actively being addressed
* 401k matching could be better.
* plan life insurance could be better

headline: Incredible culture of individual responsibility, systematic execution and fun
pros:
Chance to build your team leveraging the incredible culture but in your way with your own processes that work for you.

Compensation on all levels, generous base, performance bonuses and stock grants based on performance and teamwork.
cons: A little heavy on process in some departments. Known and work in progress.

headline: Amazing company with a great future!
pros: Five9 is a great place to work. The people are kind, hardworking, creative and generous. There's good work/life balance and very generous pay and bonus structures. Executive staff is available and approachable. There's a great culture and the company has a bright future.
cons: There's limited vacation time. Some of the systems and processes are dated and need to be moved to larger platforms now that the company is growing so quickly.

headline: Great Company!
pros: Five9 is a fantastic place to work! If you enjoy being challenged and constantly learning then Five9 is a great place. Leadership is open, honest and very transparent. The company culture is great with the mantra of "we win as a team and we loose as a team".
cons: None, this is a great place to work.

headline: Love working at Five9
pros: Working at Five9 has been my best work environment to date. The corporate culture is one that values work life balance, and all almost all employees I've worked with have the attitude of wanting to do the right thing for the right reasons. Comp is great. Career path is great. Looking forward to a long promising career at Five9!
cons: No cons that I can think of

headline: Amazing place to be at
pros:
- Unbeatable company culture
- Good work/life balance
- Transparent leadership 
- Good perks and benefits
- Amazing people work here and it’s not one of those catty environments. Truly everyone is all hands on deck
cons: CSMs not trained to use Five9 so it’s hard to drive value when customers often know more than you about your company’s solutions

headline: Great
pros:
Great Culture
Happy People
Solid Growth and Prodcut
cons: Majority of Pipeline is Self Sourced

headline: Great team and culture
pros:
- Inclusive company with LGBTQ+ employee resource group (as well as others - Blatinx, Women in tech, etc.)
- Supportive team culture
- Managers do not micromanage
- Responsive IT department that engages employees directly if you need help - I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH!
- Transparent executive staff (by SV standards)
cons:
- Low 401k matching
- PTO is limited (too low by SV standards)
- Zoom acquisition introduced a lot of uncertainty

headline: Great company to work for
pros: Great leadership team. We open and transparent with employees, empathetic and caring of the needs of its employees. Very demanding work since the company continues to grow exponentially but also very fulfilling at the end of the day. Every employees contribution is counted and appreciated.
cons: Hyper growth environment means challenging work life balance

headline: Easily one of the worst company I have ever worked with. Know your employee rights guys.
pros: Parking Location at Bishop Ranch is good, free lunch Wednesday or Friday (I forget)
cons: Very high turn over with both managers and staff. Very hostile working environment. Know your employee rights if you plan to work here. CYA from the start and keep your head on a swivel.

headline: A Growing Company That Cares
pros:
-Outstanding executive team
-Strong & genuine focus on employee well-being and satisfaction
-Your work makes an impact and is recognized
- Colleagues and managers care about your success and about you as a person
cons:
-Lean teams can result in hectic schedules 
-Typical corporate growing pains issues, but nothing significant

headline: Five9 leadership embodies culture like no other
pros: There are so many buzz words that come to mind when I think about Five9-Transparency, communication, authentic culture, respect and this starts from the top to all levels. There is something so unique about Five9 and I am so grateful to be experiencing a culture this special.
cons: There's no culture like Five9 out there

headline: Great place to work
pros: Love the family atmosphere and exceptional product suite. We look to continuously improve our products and services and it is reflected in our fantastic scores throughout the industry.
cons: With the fast-moving culture it is sometimes hard to slow down. Five9 has done an exceptional job giving us flexibility when we need to pause and catch our breath.

headline: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
pros: This company is a unicorn. The management is focused on making customers and employees happy. Engagement is through the roof and everyone is focused on common goals.
cons: Any company growing this quickly is going to suffer some growing pains. The main problem is finding enough quality workers to fill the open positions.

headline: Great company.
pros: Fantastic company to work for! Great potential for growth.
cons: Non cons at this time.

headline: Best company ever!
pros: Best culture in all of the companies I've worked at. E-Staff deeply cares about the well-being of employees. CEO is a motivational leader and a true visionary while CFO is hands-down the best in the industry.
cons: Growing pains still exist, but it's perfectly normal for a company that is accelerating at scale

headline: Awesome place to work
pros:
Incredible CEO and Executive staff - absolutely cares about employee well being 
Entire company focused and committed to customer success
Best company I have worked in my 20+ years in the industry
cons: Not really a con but cant hire fast enough to fill critical positions for growth

headline: Worst management
pros: lot of changes in management . No 401k plan .No work life balance.
cons:
Worst Micro managing team and horrible culture. I can’t believe anyone still works there under new management.
Beware of new management !!!
I would not recommend to any of my friends to work over there.
unbelievable worst organization how other reviews says good culture it is. Managers never care about team members. work life balance is horrible.

headline: 2 years in and WOW!
pros: Five9's leadership and execution is amazing. Empathetic leadership that aligns us all and provides opportunity to add value through autonomy. Best company I have ever worked for in my career
cons: Such a high growth rate company creates constant change, but it keeps things very interesting

headline: Great place to work
pros: Five9 has one of the best cultures I’ve ever experienced. The employees are incredibly helpful and supportive of each other. When Five9 says collaboration, they actually mean it.
cons: The PTO policy is pretty outdated. Unlimited PTO or accruing it at a higher amount would be fantastic.

headline: Phenomenal Leadership
pros: All the typical benefits. Rowan our CEO is down to earth and really connects with all employees. I see several comments on regarding no 401k matching, not sure where this is coming from as Five9 is contributing to mine.
cons: At this time I do not have any.

headline: Great pay and amazing company culture!
pros:
Competitive pay
Employee portion of benefits is 100% covered
Company culture
ERGs
Great leadership
cons: I can’t complain to be honest.

headline: Decent work/life balance, lots of remote opportunities, great comp package, lots of smart people
pros: They're invested in showing employees they're valued. Extra unannounced holidays, extra covid bonuses, the introduction of 12 weeks of paid parental leave, they also started a 401k match in the last couple years, in addition to throwing in money into your HSA for you, a great employee stock purchase plan, and the list goes on. In general its an environment where I'm challenged to do better, and recognized when I excel.
cons: Fast paced and busy almost all the time. This is a company that's got every going as fast as they can.

headline: Great place to work!!
pros:
Culture - Five9 cares about their employees
Value - I feel valued as a person and know that my contribution matters
I am happy to wake up and go to work every day!
cons: I have not found a con about working @ Five9.

headline: Life changing place to work
pros: Family! Great team effort where everyone is striving to make happy customers!
cons: I have worked here almost 10 years and it is by far the stronger culture in my career.

headline: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
pros:
Strong Leadership Team
Corporate Culture 
Compensation
Benefits
cons: PTO could be a little more generous, but we do occasionally get freebie days from our CEO

headline: Great Place to Work!
pros:
Working with very smart and nice people.
Leadership staff actually seem like genuinely nice people who care about their employees.
Great benefits. No problems working from home.
cons:
$2K 401k match is pretty low.
Start out with only 15 days vacation.

headline: Best Company to Work For
pros: Culture, Values, People, Compensation, Growth potential
cons: In my opinion, there are no cons working with Five9

headline: Best company I’ve ever worked for
pros: Supportive and visionary leadership, true teamwork and comraderie, transparency
cons: Product release cycles are slower than competitors

headline: Great Company, Great Culture, and Great People
pros: Challenging work. Great Team Work. The executive team is accessible and approachable. Communication at all levels is excellent. Employee stock plans and compensation are top-notch.
cons: Work/life balance suffers because of rapid growth.

headline: Five9 Rocks!
pros:
Great Overall Place to work.
Great work environment
Great employees
Family/Team Environment
Great work-life balance
Great Management and Sr. Leadership Team
Committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment
Customer-centric 
Great company values
cons: The growing pains that small growing companies experience.

headline: Supportive Work Environment
pros: Five9 genuinely cares about my well-being. They provide great benefits, diverse/inclusive teams, and have been directly helping facilitate my personal and professional growth.
cons: Engineering and Cloud Ops orgs need more women!

headline: Five9 is a great place to work!
pros: Culture, Work/Life Balance, Transparency from upper leadership, Networking and Relationship Building, Positive Learning Environment, Adaptability to Remote Work when needed.
cons: There are very few cons.

headline: Best company in the Contact Center industry to work for...period.
pros: Company and employees truly care about one another and Five9's customers.
cons: Workloads are a bit much but aren't they everywhere anymore?

headline: Best Place I've Ever Worked
pros: Five9 is hands down the best place I've ever worked, and I've had the pleasure of working for some great companies. There is a ton of opportunity to advance, and the leadership loves to help you meet your goals. Unlike most companies where keeping information tight to your vest ensures job security, at Five9, you are expected to and incentivized to share the information amongst your peers in a very collaborative fashion. This allows us to care for customers better, as well as accelerate the pace of learning exponentially. You're never on an island and the people here truly care about you. The culture is unparalleled.
cons: I think there is room for improvement with vacation, either through providing more or moving toward the trend of unlimited PTO. People at Five9 are such incredible and dedicated professionals that I can't imagine anyone taking advantage of that.

headline: Teamwork truly makes “the dream” work
pros: Family and friends mentality where all parties join together for the greater good.
cons: Not any cons to speak directly of.

headline: Best employer I have ever experienced
pros: Transparent management, clear communications, stellar colleagues, cutting edge projects
cons: Personal development time is limited

headline: Great place to work!
pros: Management really cares about work/life balance, and makes it easy to want to do your best and go above and beyond the expected.
cons: Can't think of any at the moment.

headline: acceleration and culture
pros:
best company I have ever worked for
top down amazing leadership, CEO to individual contributors are amazing
great product
culture & benefits
cons: dont have anything to add for cons

pros:
Culture

Salary

headline: Excellent Company
pros: Salary, stock options and great employees

headline: Phenomenal Employer / Growing Company
pros: Amazing culture of teamwork and collaboration. Down to earth leadership. Amazing growth potential.
cons: 401k not aligned with industry standard.

headline: Just started. Great so far!
pros: Welcoming and friendly environment. Lots of great ideas flourishing.

headline: Fantastic place to work
pros:
Flexible in work hours
Encourage work life balance
Excellent Benefits
Great Management staff

headline: Great Company, Great Culture
pros:
Opportunities for career advancement.
Approachable and wicked smart E-staff and leadership.
Collaborative environment where we're all in this together!
cons: PTO policy feels a little dated.

headline: I couldn’t imagine working for a better employer.
pros: Company culture, career growth, pay, executive leadership

headline: Great Company
pros: Great team culture and company communication. Great potential for professional growth.
cons: So far I have not encountered any.

headline: Amazing place to work!
pros: Horizontal management, open conversations, work-life balance, employee appreciation
cons: Needs to function more as a large company mindset, rather than small start-up.

headline: Great, Fast, Exciting
pros: Fast paced, Tremendous Product Suite to Sell From, Remote Work, No Micro Management
cons: Sometimes TOO Fast Paced, nothing else

headline: BEST company I've ever worked for by a land slide!
pros: Culture! Diversity and inclusion. From the first interaction with Five9 employees during the hiring process, until now nearly 9 months in, it has been an absolute pleasure and breath of fresh air. The management in the Mountain West is amazing. They are fair, they care about each of their employees, and they provide the tools and support to be successful. Being a woman in the tech industry, I have never been treated with more respect as I have here at Five9.
cons: I have not encountered one.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Great people, strong business, growing company
cons: Growing business makes for demanding work

headline: Great Place to work, but work/life balance in finance is severely lacking
pros:
--Culture is fantastic
--Benefits are comprehensive (401k matching, health)
--Company is definitely growing and there are ample opportunities for growth
cons: --Work/Life balance is severely lacking in finance. There have been instances of working multiple weekends in one month.

headline: Feel Good About Work Again!
pros: The culture is amazing here
cons: Time away is set v discretionary

headline: Great place to work
pros: Culture at Five9 is employee oriented
cons: A very fast growing company

headline: Great Company
pros:
Offers great benefits
Great people to work with
Very positive atmosphere
cons: None known at the time

headline: Incredible company, people, market and future!
pros:
Amazing market opportunity ahead of us. Great leadership team with a focus on employee satisfaction. 

Culture is second to none.
cons:
The amazing market opportunity ahead will likely create strectching points as we scale. Some of the past strategies and tactics will no longer suffice but the leadership team we have in place seems to have a great understanding of the challenges.

Also, continue to prioritize diverse hiring.

headline: Amazing
pros: Really stick with their employee's. Treated fairly and respectfully.
cons: A bit too much of the politically correct stuff going around. So much of the strife out there is personal and should not be held up by a corporation. You're not forced into any of it but it just doesn't feel right to talk about some of these things at work.

headline: Unmatched culture at Five9
pros:
All leadership including CEO is down to earth and accessible (servant leadership) 
Pay and benefits
Employees
cons: Sometimes it can feel like we are figuring things out as we go along (due to rapid growth). A lot of tribal knowledge vs documentation but this is continually getting better

headline: Five9 - The PLACE to Thrive
pros: Everything. Culture, Compensation, Benefits.. Five9 has it all
cons: Rapid growth and infrastructure challenges. Work/Life balance is taking a hit during growth, but the light at the end of the tunnel is real, as Management is actively hiring to fill the gaps.

headline: great company
pros: just a good company to work for
cons: nothing I can think of.

headline: Great company
pros: Fast paced, fast growing, great Leadership

headline: The best place to work and grow your career!
pros: Five9 is a company that takes you on as a whole employee. You are supported in your personal and professional development. Leadership assures that employees feel that they have room to grow their careers and actively discuss potential career paths you can go down. Five9 has an amazing culture that is inclusive and celebrates diversity.
cons: No cons to note on the company or culture.

headline: Fantastic Culture
pros: One of the best cultures to work for and truly care about employees. Benefits are great and would not want to work for anyone else out there right now.
cons: Harder to get promoted internally sometimes but improving on process.

headline: Good people under staffed
pros: Stock and bonus plan are nice
cons: Crazy workload and under staffed

headline: On Board for one month and loving it
pros: Great Company, excellent comp plan & amazing culture

headline: A good company with new technology intiatives
pros: Very good technical team, work culture and steadily growing company

headline: Great Leadership, Diverse Employee Population
pros:
Involved, Hands-on Leadership
Diverse Employee Population, particularly in age
Many Employee Resource Groups
Innovation Encouraged
Growth
cons:
Tribal Knowledge
Lack of IT Tools

headline: Rewarding and Fast Paced Role with Great Growth Opportunity
pros:
Great Growth Opportunities
Supportive Leadership Team
Diverse and Inclusive workplace
Team atmosphere/ Great events
Worklife balance
Competitive pay and benefits
Fast paced and innovative product

Five9 is the best company I have ever worked for. The company product is great, the leadership team is supportive and the work environment is relaxed but fast-paced and rewarding at the same time. I could not recommend this company highly enough.
cons: I have no complaints or cons

headline: Best Culture
pros: Amazing culture, strong leadership and co-workers
cons: Small company mentality, lack of infrastructure and systems to support buisness.

headline: Great company to work for
pros: No management hassles, they leave you alone to do your work.
cons: Vertical movement is difficult in the engineering level.

headline: BEST COMPANY EVER!!
pros: From the first interaction with the recruiter, all the way until now as I'm in my role, I must say that Five9 sets the standard for how companies should operate. The collaboration, inclusivity, and ability to work alongside such intelligent and driven people, motivates me to work hard every day.
cons: There are no cons in working at Five9.

headline: Project Manager
pros:
Culture is great.
CEO is transparent.
cons: Working remotely, I feel like I miss out on in person interfacing

headline: Forward Thinking
pros: Great culture and opportunities to advance your career

headline: Love Five9

cons: None that I can think of

headline: Geography Based Account Executive
pros: Strong channel presence through the Master Agent / Sub-Agent communities.
cons: No long-term relationship capabilities. New logos are handed off to the Account Management team.

headline: Fast Growing Company Led By Authentic Human Beings
pros: Real people working hard to grow a great company developing market-leading products for our customers. Servant leadership and valuing team above individual make it my favorite place to work.
cons: Five9 is scaling rapidly which can be chaotic at times for some, but fun for those who like to figure things out and build new processes.

headline: Amazing supportive culture where everyone try’s to help each other become a better version of yourself
pros: Great culture, innovation, leadership and treatment. Giving back to its employees during the pandemic to help. Number one contact center provider globally
cons: None that I can think of

headline: Love it
pros: Great work culture and leadership
cons: Experience a lot of growth so high work capacity right now

headline: Fantastic Place to Work
pros:
- Strong leadership team with very engaging vision
- Great culture focused on accountability, customer success and community
- Significant growth opportunities, both in terms of breadth of projects available and deepening vertical expertise
- Lots of cross-functional partnership between all groups
- Seamless and successful pivot to remote work / distributed workforce
- Decent benefits (401K match, no health insurance premiums, etc.)
cons: - No cons at this time

headline: Best Place I've Ever Worked
pros: Five9 puts core values at the front of every interaction.
cons: Advancement within the company can be difficult.

headline: Fantastic Company, Best decision I've ever made!
pros:
Exceptional People
Amazing Product
Outstanding Culture

Every day is a fun problem solving challenge and no two days are alike. Do well by doing good by working at Five9. Every employee is empowered to take care of our customers. Five9 takes great care of our employees knowing that by doing so, we will take great care of our customers.

If you haven't found your dream job, check out Five9. I've found mine here.
cons: We are growing extremely fast which leads to some really fun challenges.

headline: No loyalty by sales management
pros: Good Solutions consultants, but not enough for the volume of accounts needed in pipeline.
cons:
The top 5% of Sales people make a lot of $$$. Others, can hang on but expect your managers will Leave you hanging when Bigger deals need their attention.

Company culture has worsened as stock has gotten higher. Used to be more welcoming for all

headline: Best Place to Work
pros: Unbelievable culture and teamwork from the CEO down
cons: No cons from the past two years.

headline: Best in Class CCaaS Platform
pros:
- Leading edge technology with amazing NPS (net promoter score) metrics
- Company wide relentless focus on the customer and exceeding expectations
- Management keenly interested in supporting the success of the sales team and 
 being available to help with any/all questions
- Exhaustive but through and relevant training onboarding process that continues throughout one's career
- Successful track record in stock performance, EBITA, and quarter over quarter 
 growth
- Excellent management from C Suite to Regional Level
- real and legitimate "win as a team culture"
- Extensive and vibrant partner eco system
cons: - None really, there is a significant amount of company/competitor intel that one must learn to read, study and internalize. Not a negative so much as much as guidance for prospective candidates; you will be challenged at Five9; but in return, if you follow the process, you will grow into your best "self" and be able to exceed your customer's expectations and win more opportunities.

headline: Top notch culture
pros: Five9 is a growing company with a culture that is second to none. Everyone is so willing to help out, we are constantly winning as a team.
cons: I truly don’t have anything to say here

headline: Customer-Driven, Collaborative, "Can Do" Culture  and Company
pros: Mission-driven, very happy employees make it unified culture; Hard-working, professional and fun environment; great work-life balance
cons: Phasing in more processes due to growth; volume of new hires requires more rapid on-boarding.

headline: Don’t care
pros: They for the most part just let u do your job. Not much micro managing about your day to day duties.
cons: They really are just a small company that has no growth for raises or better positions.they do not have any PTo or vacation time.

headline: A company that cares
pros: Best Corporate Culture in the Industry
cons: Limited PTO for new hires

headline: Good Company
pros: Good enough, flexible work hours
cons: commute is a bit far from the South Bay

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Company is very collaborative with a great culture and lots of growth and opportunity.
cons: Sometimes there are too many meetings that aren't always needed.

headline: Great Place to Be
pros: Culture - Everyone is on the same team here. There are no visible corporate politics. It feels good to come to work everyday. In 20 years and multiple companies, this IS the best company I've ever worked for.
cons: Honest answer....I can't think of any. I know, crazy right? But seriously, this is the best company to work for in this industry.

headline: The best career move!
pros: Five9 is a proven company with a market-leading product, an incredibly talented team, and supportive leadership. A fun place to be where every day is filled with problem solving and team collaboration.
cons: Things move so fast, it can be challenging to keep everyone on the same page.

headline: Not what is used to be.
pros: Benefits if your single. RSUs at sign on. Very supportive coworkers at your level since everyone is in the same trench.
cons:
Sick time does not exit- If you get sick you have to take it out of your PTO but they overly push working extra hours a week and everyone is salaried. 
The benefits if you need to provide for a family aren't great. 
Pay raises are very minimal and RSUs are not given out after your hiring alottment if your not management.
Sales will write up SOs that are not what the customer wanted or tell them don't the other divisions will do it for free (which goes against the billable time requirements)

headline: Great Company
pros: Five9 is a friendly company and values their people. That message comes from the top
cons: some support resources are only in PST

headline: Great CEO
pros:
CEO is world class. He has hired some great people to join his C-Staff.
RSU's are nice
cons: There are growing pains currently happening. Sales operations having hard time keeping up with our expanding sales team.

headline: They'll have to kick me out
pros: Amazing teamwork, great compensation, industry leading product
cons: Can't hire people fast enough. Typical growing pains.

headline: One of the best organizations to work for!
pros:
- Great culture
- Invests in innovation
- Best sales team
cons: - Needs more cross-functional org processes

headline: Truly a special place to work
pros: Company Culture. A sincere focus to deliver great solutions to clients coupled with a superior delivery and support model.
cons: No 401k match. However, the RSU's are generous which makes up for it.

headline: Amazing Place To Work
pros: Lots of opportunities to provide input and be heard
cons: Lots and lots of hours.

headline: Love this place
pros: A cohesive, caring group of people that believe in the company and each other. Decent pay and benefits.
cons: Can be long hours, but where isn't it?

headline: What a breath of fresh air
pros: There are many accolades, but simply put I would start with, "trust," which is key to me. From my start, I am seeing this isn't a focus from the bottom, but accountability is visible from the top down and vice versa. Five9 is definitely employee-centric, knowledge sharing, provides good pay, and is a giant when it comes to proper and great communication. This isn't just a factor of sharing ideals, but education and ownership.
cons: The software is 100% cloud-based, and coming from a hybrid, or primarily premise-based history, having such flexibility would be good.

headline: Exceeded my expectations!
pros:
-Amazing company culture
-Collaborative team selling
-Great product innovation
-Best in class professional services
-Extremely positive atmosphere
cons: Currently no full match on 401k

headline: Disgusting, toxic leadership and a hostile sales environment
pros: The Five9 brand is very strong in the market as a cloud player which allows them to get a seat to the table and be competitive in particular segments. Five9 has superior service to their customers. Their CEO has done a great job promoting the idea of great culture.
cons: Inside the sales organization for the west there are multiple complaints and investigations into unfair practices towards women and a hostile working environment created by favoritism. However, nothing has been done about it. Agency partners have not only complained but refuse to work with the Sr leadership team due to their disgust with the leadership style, or lack there of. It is unfortunate that such a great company has let certain individuals have such a dramatic impact on an organization. Like the good ol's boys club of the mountain west territory. Disgusting.

headline: Best place to work
pros: They give stock incentives. 401k, culture is great! Cutting edge tech.
cons: Growing so fast can make it hard to keep up with customer asks.

headline: Great Time to be with Five9
pros: Pay is great, great market leader, superb, supportive leadership, potential career growth, pandemic proof, great & frequent exposure to our upper level employees
cons: High expectations that need to be met (although understandable in sales). Tough during the pandemic, but overall Five9 fits well for a remote environment so we were able to see a lot of success

headline: Great company and great Culture! People are hard working!
pros: Flexibility in hours of work
cons: Nothing to comment on this yet

headline: Great Company to Work For
pros: Supportive culture, innovative product, tons of potential for career growth.
cons: Would like to see more diversity within the leadership team.

headline: Great Company and Culture
pros: Great benefits, world-class management, competent employees
cons: Teams spread out across US/World makes things move slower than should

headline: Believe the CULTURE hype!
pros: I've long admired Five9 and some former colleagues who have been there for several years but assumed the "culture" speak was more marketing than reality like it is at so many places. Happy to report that after 2 weeks on the job, it's very real. I've spoken to over 25 team members and 100% of them said, "This is the best company they've ever worked for." That includes some serious industry vets with 25+ years of experience. The commitment to the team and our customers is second to none!
cons: Haven't seen any yet thus far

headline: Great company but lacked transparency in the future of certain departments
pros: Great HR department, exciting products, and lots of projects to work on.
cons: Lack of work/life balance, extensive meetings, and unclear on where the company's priorities are for certain departments

headline: Security is not a priority
pros: Honestly I don't see any
cons: Compliance is not security and company priority is uptime.

headline: Great Company
pros:
Good work/life balance
Great Pay
Flexible schedules
Great Health Benefits
cons: 401K match could be better

headline: Amazing culture
pros: A transparent and trusting culture that is not full of politics and massive ego's. Teamwork across areas is best I've seen, and responsiveness and flexibility internally is best-in-class. Leadership has a great balance of driving results and truly caring about people and customers in a genuine way.
cons: Not any at this time

headline: Awesome place to work
pros: Culture is second to none
cons: No negative of working here

headline: Best job I've ever had
pros: The culture is beyond fantastic. Leadership's drive and plans for the future are communicated throughout the organization, which makes you feel like you're part of something special. You get to work with individuals that want to help drive success.
cons: Workload can get extreme, but that is to be expected when in serious growth mode.

headline: Great Company!!
pros: Five9 CEO is hands down one of the most personable / approachable I've ever worked for. He's very focused on employee engagement and employee well being. Which is unheard of from my experience. Very refreshing!
cons: No Con's that are worthy of posting here. I love my job and would highly recommend Five9 to anyone!

headline: Great company, culture, and people
pros: Everyone has a Can-Do Attitude. Love the teamwork here at Five9!
cons: Nothing. Keep up the great work.

headline: good company
pros: Good company with great coworkers
cons: management didn't answer a lot of questions when asked

headline: Great Company
pros: Company moving in the right direction. Has put measures in place for employees to have feel appreciated. Will continue to work here.
cons: None at the moment for the company.

headline: Excellent work environmen
pros: Team environment great Benefits excellent leadership
cons: None Been here over 1 year and it’s everything I was promised !

headline: Refreshing in the corporate world!
pros: Executive team works towards full transparency! Work/life balance is a high priority!
cons: Salary/401K match is a little less than industry standard but Five9 makes up for it with stock options and stock buy back opportunities!

headline: Great place to work
pros:
Many benefits and a challenging environment. 
Great learning opportunity and plenty of responsibility
cons: ever-changing priorities make for a challenging work environment. No two days will be the same.

headline: Five9 is AMAZING
pros: Excellent culture and leadership. Autonomy and trust have been afforded to all employees. Great pay and flexible working hours
cons: No real cons--platform stability and base code are continuously updated which can be frustrating to customers

headline: Fun to work at
pros: Very nice culture, Always supportive
cons: Very fast moving, you need to be on toes all the time

headline: Come Join Us!
pros: Fantastic culture of problem solving
cons: Biased, but can't think of one

headline: A tech gem
pros:
The leadership is fanatical about preserving the culture and I understand why. 
There's a strong family and friends vibe, where there's true inclusion from its earlier days. The company is now trying to balance that with the hyper growth it's experiencing.  People here  are hard working, have no egos, and willing to have honest conversations.
cons: Business tools/systems are old and have limited functionalities.  Lots of manual workarounds makes work prone to human error.  They've filled the tools gap with great people, but scaling and creating sustainable programs will be hard if processes remain manual.  A good ERP tool needs to be put in place.

headline: A software company.
pros: Mostly great engineers, positive atmosphere
cons: Fairly stale software architecture and boring product

headline: Extremely respectful environment
pros: Exec staff is extremely approachable. The company truly embraces diversity, and encourages creative thinking.
cons: Some of the senior execs could improve their presentation skills, but they all really mean well and come across as good people.

headline: Great Company is hitting on all cylinders
pros: Cloud Technology, Exec Leadership, Customer Focus, Work Culture, Employee Support, Remote Work
cons: High Bay Area cost of living.

headline: Incredible Company
pros: Excellent culture, fun place to work, tons of support to help all succeed
cons: can't think of a single con

headline: I love it here
pros:
The people
The opportunities for learning and growing
Leadership is approachable and genuine
Adaptability of the organization to unexpected change
cons: The accelerated growth of the company can be challenging in terms of workload

headline: Five9 Company Culture - A real differentiator and unique to the brand!
pros: Your contributions are appreciated, an incredibly talented and support executive leadership team led by our amazing CEO Rowan Trollope,
cons: None come to mind, all the days do go fast and we are always productively busy!!

headline: Enterprise Sales Director
pros: Great Leadership, great team work and culture
cons: Fast paced, a lot of follow up and long sales cycle

headline: Most Annoying Office Politicians
pros: overall good work culture, good benefits
cons: couple of managers both in product and engineering are Tyrant, Viper, Sad Sack, and Frenemy.

headline: Great company
pros: Very strong team of top level professionals.
cons: Often people are overloaded, but this is common for many companies.

headline: Amazing culture!
pros: Great culture, great pay, and awesome work-life balance
cons: Sometimes you may need to firefight when things are on a tight deadline. But this is easily avoidable if you communicate properly between teams.

headline: The Best Company I Have Worked For In My Career
pros: The Five9 culture is like family.  The leadership team is incredibly supportive and transparent.  It's a place where you feel enabled to be successful and we are focused on the success of our customers.  We work hard and play hard.
cons: None - this is a great company!

headline: Great Benefits
pros: Wonderful culture with great employee programs. Company goes above and beyond to take care of employees with benefits, flexible WFH, development programs and a Relief bonus during COVID. Great leadership.
cons: Fast growth puts a strain on some teams that are under-resourced.

headline: Convenient place to work in
pros: Reliable company you can count on.
cons: No cutting edge technologies. You won't get much new knowledge working here

headline: Why Five9?
pros: The culture at five9 is unlike any other company. Everyone around you is working together as a team. We are all focused on one goal, which is our customers and how we can provide the best experience not only for them but for their customers.
cons: Its a lot to learn and you are trained to a point but at some point you are  just thrown in to it but I think that's the best way to learn

headline: Growing company
pros: Good group of people. Hard workers.
cons: Very political. Management is out for their own good.

headline: Amazing management team
pros: Very positive and amazing Executive Team
cons: There are none that I can think of.

headline: Great place
pros: Money, team, atmosphere, ability to take time off if you need
cons: None-CEO will motivate you to crush it.

headline: Amazing Culture & Tremendous Growth Opportunities
pros: The culture is truly amazing.  There is a structure of support and teamwork that crosses all job categories and functions.  Extremely customer focused while at the same time being employee focused.  A truly great place to work.
cons: Limited PTO for new employees and behind the times maternity leave policy.

headline: Great place to be and a great time to be here!
pros: Culture - Transparent and positive.  Focused on teamwork.  Very supportive environment and a fantastic marketing opportunity.  Lot's of growth.
cons: Typical growth challenges.  Working through the kinks in process and how to grow in a sustainable ways.

headline: Excellent Employer with Great Culture and Incredible Management Team
pros: Lazer Focus, Consistent Growth, Successful Processes, and Employees who all go above and beyond to service our customers
cons: Speed of Growth has potential to create issues, but so far the management team has been exceptional at navigating this challenge

headline: Rapid growth and solid leadership
pros: Company is small and growing, lots of opportunities.  Leadership and culture values employees.  Compensation is competitive and the sign on bonus was nice.
cons: 401k match is minimal, should be expanded to a % match instead of the current breakdown.  Amount of vacation days are ok, but not great.

headline: High Standards for a Small Company
pros: This is a good opportunity to work with the real tools and do the high quality work you might find at Amazon, Netflix, or Google without having to go through the absurd hiring processes of those companies.
cons: Lots of focus on sales.

headline: lots of opportunities to learn and grow
pros:
- lots of learning
- interesting projects on the edge of technology
- growth opportunities
- new tech management with big ideas
- talented engineers that you can learn from and discuss
- great benefits and company overall growth (check FIVN stock chart)
cons:
- some "politics" like it is everywhere in this size of the company
- office space is boring, no fun stuff
- no snacks in kitchen, no food (except Friday lunch)

headline: Great place to work
pros: Five9 is a selling machine with great product and people.  Previous growth and great potential make this a very exciting place to work.
cons: Constant growth brings the typical concerns that all growing companies face.

headline: Five9 is on fire!
pros: Culture is nearly indescribable and difficult to comprehend until you work here. Extremely talented and engaged E-staff. Great near and long term vision.
cons: Perceived industry perception of Five9 needs to improve.

headline: A silent company growing in a fantastic way
pros:
Company moving to a cloud base solutions and have a chance to work on new technologies stack
Good work life balance
WFH option
Friday lunch
Moderate benefits
cons: Company has to advertise itself, because many people not know about company

headline: Great workplacee, investing in improving development
pros: Great people, commitment to invest in Product Division,
cons: New to cloud computing, still learning the ropes.

headline: great company,
pros:
work life balance
somewaht exciting work
sfdc partner
cons: needs to bring on a-players

headline: Politics at engineer level
pros: Work From Home,  Thursdays in clouds,  catered lunch once a week, ESPP
cons: Some long timers do politics at Engineer level.  I know of one guy who implemented lot of AI stuff and was left in lurch after another long time Engineer (does not know technology)  did politics on him.  What a wasted engineer resource after all to the company.

headline: Account Manager
pros: Great place to work and well taken care of.
cons: Nothing comes to mind really.

headline: Good company
pros: Strong enough team to grow at
cons: Big product with old parts

headline: Great pay and benefits!
pros:
Medical benefits were practically free.
Very nice coworkers with a company culture to treat everyone with respect
Work life balance
cons:
Behind the times in the use of current business applications.
No formal employee development process
Advancement is based on your social network within the company..friends hiring and promoting friends

headline: It's like an extended family
pros: I have been at Five9 going on five years.  I have never been so  happy.  I feel extremely comfortable with everyone on my team.  We all seem to pull together to make it happen and help each other succeed. VP of SMB is awesome.  He will push you if he think your slipping, but you know he wants you to succeed.  My director is great,  always ready to help me close a deal and take care of the fires when needed.  I come from the dotcom era where it was not uncommon to change jobs every couple of years.  I do not plan on leaving Five9 anytime soon.
cons: It is far from my home.  I travel almost 100 miles a day just to get back and forth to work.  It would be great if they had better work from home options.

headline: Compared to the competitors I've worked for in the Contact Center Industry....Five9 ROCKS!
pros: Five9 is Agile, Nimble, Quick, Forward-Thinking, and Fast-Paced.  The general atmosphere is very comfortable and supportive.  Because Five9 is smaller and on the growth up-swing, there is a lot of flexibility to influence changes and make a difference, whereas with larger companies, that's not possible.  The Executive Management Team is very focused and engaged. When they say they are going to do something....it happens. They are also VERY forthcoming with the entire organization as to challenges, goals, plans ,etc. WAY more-so than any other company I've worked for. It's refreshing because you feel as though you are part of the Vision and the Operational Agenda.
cons: The biggest challenges are the usual challenges any company who is growing faces. As we bring on a ton of new customers, we need to scale.

headline: I like my job for the first time in years!
pros:
- Senior Management cares about its employees and their customers
- Even though it can be a high stress environment their is not much infighting or back room deal making between the departments and teams.
- Good benefits, great employee perks
- Leveraging new technology to improve the product and the customer experience
cons:
- Not always waiting until a product is ready before its released
- Internal communications need to be more open too many silos between different teams leads to poor messaging to the customer

headline: Hit or miss
pros: With Five9, it's a hit-or-miss situation. Depending on the team you join and your professional goals, you may love or hate it. If you are not extremely ambitious and just want an okay place that earns you some cash, Five9 is a decent option. Bishop Ranch location is awesome, nice environment, whole foods nearby, food trucks a few times a week. Also, company has some nice events, like the annual ski day held at Kirkwood.
cons: The company doesn't seem to do all that well on the market, that's a concern for the future and it also reflects potential internal issues that are not being resolved. Lack of competence and proper leadership in some teams and areas is a source of frustration. Also, the company is not very generous when it comes to promotions and yearly salary adjustments. The overall attitude towards employees sometimes falls short, especially in tough situations when someone has to leave the company.

headline: Five9 is Family!
pros:
This is only my 4th full-time job out of college but by FAR the best workplace environment I have ever been apart of. The moment I started at Five9, I just felt like this place is one big family.

Sure, things are busy, but that is a good problem to have. I have never had a colleague tell me that they couldn't help me when I had a question or tell me "that's not my problem".

Everyone is willing to step in and help out and that makes the work environment top notch.

This is also a great place where I feel like PS and Sales get along with each other, unlike previous companies where it was always a battle between the two.
cons:
No 401k match

Lots of moving parts, don't forget about the core product and keeping it as stable as possible.

headline: Happily Employed
pros:
Management is open to questions and feedback
People are Flexible, help each other and work as a team
Many individuals can work remotely
Salaries are quite reasonable (Average+), and the stock and our grants  are moving skyward
Depending upon your responsibilities, you may have some flexibility in terms of your schedule
It is nice to work for a company, in the Valley, that is growing, stable, and that has revenue and profits
cons:
Management is considering 401k match, but does not exist today (Stock grants and the ESPP help ameliorate the deficiency)
The company is growing clients and certain departments can use more staff.  Good and bad...the company is focused on hiring based upon need, but they are conservative and do not want to hire too many during a boom cycle.
There is plenty of work to keep one busy - But, management is good with time off and work / life balance

headline: If only they followed through on what they say
pros: Ability to interact with customers on a daily basis, whether it's to solve, resolve, and/or collaborate on questions, comments, and/or concerns.
cons: Many leaders that were less than stellar.  Leaders that didn't take time to teach, train, give constructive criticism, nor work together to find a way to resolve an issue.  There were no processes put in place.  Each time an issue arose it was like starting all over again.  Outcomes were never repeatable so it was as though you were re-inventing the wheel over and over and over again.  Onboarding/training a new employee was atrocious.  There was never a defined process written up for this very important step.  New employees constantly felt inferior vs. confident and always worried when "they were going to lose their job".

headline: Five9 - Great culture, solid trajectory and significant upside
pros:
Five9 has a great culture that trickles down from the very top. Everyone works extremely hard but equally appreciates the importance of maintaining a good work / life balance and having fun along the way. 

Additionally, the company still has a start-up feel to it with people at all levels rolling up their sleeves to get things done effectively and efficiently, and senior management truly recognizes and rewards talent based on meritocracy.

Leadership quality and business execution capabilities are top notch in the industry. Overall, I believe Five9 is on a very solid trajectory with significant upside potential.
cons: Five9 is expanding rapidly, so, naturally, there are growing pains (e.g., using systems that are more appropriate for smaller sized organizations, ongoing refinement of processes, etc.). However, these are common issues that all fast-growing tech companies struggle with temporarily, so I'm confident that these will be resolved in the not-too-distant future.

headline: Enterprise Sales Director
pros:
Lots of companies talk culture, but what does that really mean?  To me it means you respect the people you work with, and they respect you.  It means you're given the resources to be successful and trusted to do so.  Five9 does more than just talk about having a strong culture.  They deliver it.

This is a company that is well positioned to succeed as more and more companies move towards the cloud.  The product is solid and the execution even more so.  

Lots of career growth opportunity.

Very strong leadership, deep experience and continuing to hire top talent.
cons:
Compensation and benefits are average compared to industry peers.

This is a very fast paced environment, which isn't for everyone, but the upside is there is lots of opportunity.

Office space is ok, but the investments are being made towards customers, products and growth, rather than having the prettiest building.

headline: Great Start, Promising Future
pros: I have the privilege of working with quality professionals and people. The company is at a stage where it's growing, but flexible enough to implement change in process when needed. I look forward to coming to the office, sharing ideas, and feeling rewarded for the efforts in helping the team and Five9.
cons: The company is lacking process, and change does not happen overnight. Most people are open to change, but others need more convincing. There is currently no 401K match, but outside of that the benefits package is great!

headline: Great Executive Staff, Company, Culture, and People!
pros:
A great company starts with great leadership and Mike is an amazing CEO that cares about his people and ensuring we have a great culture and all else follows when this foundation is set for people to do amazing things. I am a product manager and work with every group and team throughout the company. The one common trait I have discovered is that everybody cares and wants Five9 to succeed because they believe in the leadership and the people in the company.
Company events are amazing and fun. The catered lunches are always fantastic!
cons: Just wish they would bring the catered lunch to the 5th floor since the lines get long on the 4th floor for Friday catered lunches. Other than that, I love it here!

headline: Five9 has the energy of a start-up, the expertise of a legacy, and the growth potential of Starbucks circa 1990.
pros: Five9 is growing at an extremely quick pace, and employment is growing with it to a very corollary degree. Everyone here is attempting to increase productivity and improve the product and company. Management recognizes that sheer manpower is necessary to do so. Upper management is also extremely involved and concerned with lower level work capabilities and strives to create a seamless environment (ie ensuring projects do not bottleneck at the top).
cons: There are some standard growing pains with Five9. As a rapidly growing company, it is difficult to ensure that every voice is heard, and that the total company culture truly exemplifies what individual departments are putting forward.

headline: Good company, normal growing pains
pros: The company has a great product and roadmap, and is poised to be a serious competitor. IMO, we are an underdog that is still climbing our way up, based on our strong market potential. To me, this is a great time to be here and watch the success unfold. The company and management team values work-life balance, and does a lot to foster that culture through activities, free friday lunches, etc.
cons: As with any fast growing company, we do have growing pains. Processes need optimizing, and we could use some training and development plans for the existing teams.
